author: Google Gemini 2.0 Flash 001
Teoderick Contreras, Splunk
description: Google Gemini 2.0 Flash 001: The following analytic detects suspicious file permissions modifications using the chattr command, which may indicate an attacker attempting to manipulate file attributes to evade detection or prevent alteration. The chattr command can be used to make files immutable or restrict deletion, which can be leveraged to protect malicious files or disrupt system operations. By monitoring for unusual or unauthorized chattr usage, this analytic helps identify potential tampering with critical files, enabling security teams to quickly respond to and mitigate threats associated with unauthorized file attribute changes. Converted with Google Gemini 2.0 Flash 001
false_positives: Administrator or network operator can use this application for automation purposes. Please update the filter macros to remove false positives.
name: Google Gemini 2.0 Flash 001: Linux Auditd File Permissions Modification Via Chattr
note: Investigate the process details and the files being modified. Determine if the activity is authorized and legitimate.

technique.name: File and Directory Permissions Modification: Linux and Mac File and Directory Permissions Modification

query:
sequence by process.entity_id
  [process where event.type == "start" and process.name == "chattr" and process.args like "%-i%"]
  [file where file.path != null]
